title: Ticket #4575: Daemons with a debug lock file should leave log open
description:
When multiple daemons are writing to the same debug log file, we use a lock file during log rotation to avoid race conditions. To ensure that all daemons use the newly-rotated file, each daemon closes the file after every write and reopens it before the next write. This is needlessly inefficient.

Instead, the daemons can leave the log file open, and use the following procedure to ensure rotation happens when necessary and daemons always write to the newest log file:

  • Use lseek() to find the current file size.
  • If it's not time to rotate, then write line as usual and skip remaining steps.
  • Acquire lock.
  • Fstat() the open file descriptor and stat() the log file using its filename.
  • Close the file descriptor for the log file.
  • If the two stat structs identify the same file, then perform rotation.
  • Open log file.
  • Release lock.
  • Now we're ready to write the requested line.

On windows (and if LOCK_DEBUG_LOG_TO_APPEND=True on unix), the lock is held the entire time the log file is open. We would need to change that.
